summary: This is an email chain from March 2021 regarding the US v. Maxwell case. It forwards a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys concerning a discovery request and proposes rescheduling a call to discuss the issues raised and the drafting of a superseding indictment memorandum.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who sent the original discovery request letter on March 8, 2021.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the original discovery request letter from Maxwell's legal team.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP copied on the original discovery request letter.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the original discovery request letter.

connections.description: Both are listed as counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in the case US v. Maxwell.
Both are part of the defense legal team for Ghislaine Maxwell, copied on the same correspondence.
Both are attorneys involved in the Maxwell defense, with Everdell from an external firm (Cohen & Gresser).

events.title: Discovery Request Letter Sent
events.description: Maxwell's attorneys, led by Laura Menninger, send a formal discovery request letter to the US Attorney's Office.

events.title: Prosecution Call Rescheduling
events.description: A prosecutor proposes rescheduling a call to discuss the defense's discovery request and the drafting of a superseding indictment memorandum.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email among prosecutors discussing a discovery request from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
The defense letter was sent by attorney Laura Menninger on March 8, 2021, and copied to Jeff Pagliuca, Christian R. Everdell, and Bobbi C. Sternheim.
The prosecution was simultaneously working on a 'superseder pros memo' (superseding indictment memorandum) and needed to discuss the defense's discovery issues.
The email shows active pre-trial litigation and evidence sharing in the US v. Maxwell case in March 2021.
